title: Khalid of Saudi Arabia
summary: Khalid bin Abdulaziz Al Saud (Arabic: خالد بن عبد العزيز آل سعود‎ Khalid ibn ʿAbd al ʿAzīz Āl Suʿūd; 13 February 1913 –  13 June 1982) was a Saudi Arabian statesman and politician who served as King of Saudi Arabia from 25 March 1975 to his death in 1982. Prior to his ascension, he was Crown Prince of Saudi Arabia from 29 March 1965 to 25 March 1975. He was the fifth son of King Abdulaziz, the founder of modern Saudi Arabia. He was the third of Abdulaziz's six sons who were kings (the others were Saud, Faisal, Fahd, Abdullah and Salman).
